title: Essential Software Principles: YAGNI, KISS, and DRY

definitions.definition: You Ain't Gonna Need It. Only implement functionality when it is necessary, avoiding overengineering by not adding features that may never be used.
Keep It Simple, Stupid. Design and implement solutions in a straightforward manner, minimizing complexity and unnecessary complications.
Don't Repeat Yourself. Avoid duplication in code by abstracting common logic into reusable components, ensuring maintainability and reducing errors.
